Gene-ref.Gene-ref_desc: family with sequence similarity 72, member A

Gene-commentary.Gene-commentary_text: family with sequence similarity 72, member A

Gene-commentary.Gene-commentary_heading: RefSeqs maintained independently of Annotated Genomes
RefSeqs of Annotated Genomes: Homo sapiens Annotation Release 105

Gene-commentary.Gene-commentary_text: this study provides an additional possible mechanism of neurotoxicity in Alzheimer's disease, the induction of p17(FAM72B), through which Abeta acts to induce apoptosis and exhibit other Alzheimer's disease characteristics.
It was found that Ugene, designated herein as LMP1-induced protein (LMPIP), was induced, in a time-dependent manner, in EBV-infected peripheral blood mononuclear cells and LMP1-transfected 293 cells.

Using deletion constructs, the authors find that Ugene binds to the first 25 amino acids of the UNG2 NH(2) terminus. They suggest that Ugene induction in cancer may contribute to the cancer phenotype by interacting with the BER pathway.
